gen.metadata.title: Design of a wideband circularly polarized 2 x 2 array with shorted annular patches at X-band on a CubeSat
gen.objectives.main_objective: To design a single layer wideband circularly polarized 2 x 2 microstrip array at X-band frequencies for a 1U CubeSat (p. 1)
gen.objectives.specific_objectives: Model the 2 x 2 array on a 1U CubeSat (p. 1); Compare the performance of the 2 x 2 array to a single element microstrip antenna (p. 1)
gen.recommendations.for_future_research: Investigation of the array's performance in real-world satellite communication scenarios (p. 2)
gen.recommendations.for_practice: Further testing and validation of the design through measured results (p. 2)
gen.research_problem.problem_statement: The need for a wideband circularly polarized antenna for radio communication systems on nano-satellites, specifically 1U CubeSats (p. 1)
gen.research_problem.research_questions: How can a single layer 2 x 2 microstrip array using shorted annular patch elements be designed for X-band frequencies? (p. 1); What are the performance benefits of the 2 x 2 array compared to a single element microstrip antenna? (p. 1)
esp.domain_results.comparison_with_other: The 2 x 2 array outperforms a single element microstrip antenna in terms of wideband circular polarization (p. 2)
esp.technical_specifications.antenna_typ: 2 x 2 microstrip array with shorted annular patches (p. 1)

gen.metadata.authors: Lei Wang; Jiayu Rao; Symon K. Podilchak; Yuepei Li; Yuan Ding
gen.metadata.title: A 3-D metal printed folded-shorted patch array with an integrated feeding circuit offering dual-band circularly polarised radiation for cubesat applications
gen.objectives.main_objective: To investigate the use of 3-D metal printing technology for the fabrication of a miniaturised CP antenna for dual-band communications in CubeSats (p. 4)
gen.objectives.specific_objectives: Measure the performance metrics including gain, bandwidth, and efficiency (p. 4); Optimize the dimensions of the radiating slots for dual-band operation (p. 2); Achieve consistent fabrication quality of FSP elements (p. 2); Integrate a wideband feeding network for CP functionality (p. 2); Design and fabricate a 2 by 2 array of FSP elements (p. 4)
gen.recommendations.for_future_research: Investigation of the antenna's performance in space environments (p. 5); Investigate the impact of environmental conditions on the performance of 3-D printed FSP antennas (p. 3); Development of multi-band and multi-functional antenna designs (p. 5)
gen.recommendations.for_practice: Use 3-D metal printing technology for consistent fabrication of FSP elements (p. 2); Further optimization of the feeding circuit for improved performance (p. 5); Optimize radiating slot dimensions for dual-band operation (p. 2); Exploration of different array configurations for versatility (p. 5)
gen.research_problem.problem_statement: Challenges in achieving consistent fabrication quality and dual-band operation for compact antennas in CubeSats (p. 1)
gen.research_problem.research_questions: How can 3-D metal printing technology improve the fabrication consistency and dual-band operation of folded-shorted patch (FSP) antennas for CubeSats? (p. 1); What are the performance metrics of the proposed antenna design compared to existing designs? (p. 4); How can 3-D metal printing technology be used to fabricate a miniaturised CP antenna for CubeSats? (p. 4); What are the performance metrics of the proposed 3-D printed FSP antenna array? (p. 1)
esp.domain_methodology.simulation_method: HFSS FEM method and QNM package (p. 4)
esp.domain_results.comparison_with_other: Outperforms other designs in terms of size, dual-band functionality, and efficiency (p. 4)
esp.domain_results.cross_polarization_le: More than 20 dB below the main beam maximum at broadside (p. 3)
esp.domain_results.gain: 2.32 dBic at 1.2 GHz and 1.84 dBic at 2.45 GHz (p. 5)
esp.technical_specifications.antenna_siz: 0.4 × 0.4 × 0.056 λ³₀ (where λ₀ is the free space wavelength at 1.2 GHz) (p. 2)
esp.technical_specifications.antenna_typ: Miniaturised CP antenna using 3-D metal printing (p. 4)
esp.technical_specifications.feeding_ele: Five-port feeding network with 180° and 90° couplers (p. 2)

gen.metadata.authors: Gustavo A. Puerto-Leguizamón; Suárez-Fajardo, C. A.; Cristiam D. Martín-Jackson; Puerto Leguizamón, G. A.; López, J. K.; Carlos A. Suárez-Fajardo
gen.metadata.title: Antena de Parche Cortocircuitado con Polarización Circular y Sentido de Giro Reconfigurable para Aplicaciones en Satélites de Reducido Tamaño
gen.objectives.main_objective: To design and characterize a circular microstrip patch antenna with reconfigurable circular polarization for small satellites (CubeSat 1U) (p. 1)
gen.objectives.specific_objectives: Achieve an axial ratio bandwidth of 48.56 MHz (2%) at 2.44 GHz (p. 7); Achieve an axial ratio bandwidth of 48.56MHz (2%) (p. 1); Achieve a maximum gain of 6.04dBi (p. 1); Achieve a maximum gain of 6.04 dB at 2.44 GHz (p. 7); Achieve an impedance bandwidth of 27.44% (p. 1)
gen.recommendations.for_future_research: Investigate the impact of different hybrid couplers on antenna performance (p. 8); Explore further optimization techniques to enhance performance (p. 3)
gen.recommendations.for_practice: Integrate the antenna design into CubeSat 1U for improved communication performance (p. 3); Use the hybrid coupler for reconfigurable rotation direction in CubeSat applications (p. 8)
gen.research_problem.problem_statement: Design of a short-circuited patch antenna with circular polarization and reconfigurable rotation direction for CubeSat 1U applications (p. 6)
gen.research_problem.research_questions: How can the bandwidth and gain of the antenna be optimized for CubeSat applications? (p. 6); What is the impact of the hybrid coupler on the antenna's performance? (p. 6); What are the performance metrics of the proposed antenna design? (p. 1); How can a circular microstrip patch antenna be designed to achieve reconfigurable circular polarization? (p. 1)
esp.technical_specifications.antenna_typ: Short-circuited patch antenna with circular polarization and reconfigurable rotation direction (p. 6)
esp.technical_specifications.feeding_ele: 90° hybrid coupler feeding the antenna at two points (p. 6)

gen.metadata.authors: Kai Xue; Yong Luo; Yelei Yao; Jianxun Wang; Esmond Agurgo Balfour; Shaowei Liao
gen.metadata.title: A Dual-Feed, L/S-Dual-Band-Stacked, CP Patch Antenna System for 3U CubeSat
gen.objectives.main_objective: To develop a dual-feed, L/S-dual-band-stacked, circularly polarized patch antenna system for a 3U CubeSat (p. 2)
gen.objectives.specific_objectives: Design and optimize the antenna and feeding network (p. 2); Maintain high stability and reliability (p. 5); Achieve a low profile of 11 mm (p. 5); Fabricate and measure the prototype (p. 3); Ensure excellent right-hand CP (RHCP) characteristics (p. 5); Obtain an HPBW of more than 80° for both bands (p. 5)
gen.recommendations.for_future_research: Conduct further testing with the spacecraft body to validate performance (p. 4); Not mentioned
gen.recommendations.for_practice: Integrate the designed antenna system into CubeSats for high-data-rate communication (p. 4); Design the antenna in a slightly lower frequency and adjust it to the desired frequency by cutting the four stubs shorter during the experiment (p. 5)
gen.research_problem.problem_statement: The need for high-data-rate communication systems in CubeSats, which are constrained by size and weight, and the challenges of multiple-antenna design (p. 1)
gen.research_problem.research_questions: How can a dual-feed, L/S-dual-band-stacked, circularly polarized patch antenna be designed for CubeSats? (p. 2); How can a dual-feed, L/S-dual-band-stacked, CP patch antenna system be designed for 3U CubeSats? (p. 5); What are the performance metrics of the designed antenna? (p. 4)
esp.domain_methodology.measurement_condi: An in-house far-field antenna measurement system and an Agilent network analyzer (E5071C) (p. 4)
esp.domain_methodology.simulation_method: HFSS FEM method and QNM package (p. 5)
esp.technical_specifications.antenna_typ: Dual-feed, L/S-dual-band-stacked, circularly polarized patch antenna (p. 1)
esp.technical_specifications.fabrication: Rogers RT/duroid 5880 (εr = 2.2, tan δ = 0.0009, h = 0.787 mm) (p. 3)
